page.title: 11THE CANAL IN ADLINGTON.
page.content: The Macclesfield Canal, opened in 1831 for transport, is now used for recreation, mainly boating , walking and fishing. It is popular with people who have motor-launches kept at "Marinas" built on the canal and with canoeists. There are many hire-boats, both motor-launches and converted narrow boats. Recently the tow-path has been repaired and stiles put in so that walkers can link the canal with the new "Middlewood Way" walk. Many bridges have stone steps from the roads to the tow-path and these have been restored. This work was carried out by the Borough Council with finance from the Countryside Commission and labour from the Manpower Services Commission. There is a wealth of wild flowers and bird-life for naturalists to enjoy.
